item.description:
Come join us on a five-mile walk from the marshes of the Back Bay Fens to the meadows and woodlands of Franklin Park. This six-hour tour will explore the diverse landscapes of Frederick Law Olmsted’s masterpiece of park design and will be led by Alan Banks from Frederick Law Olmsted National Historic Site in Brookline. Along the way, people from various groups and agencies will meet the group and discuss how they are trying to interpret Olmsted’s 19th-century vision in a 21st-century world. This walk is co-sponsored by Common Boston, Circle The City, Frederick Law Olmsted National Historic Site and the Friends of Fairsted. For more information, contact Alan Banks at 617-566-169, x221, or alan_banks@nps.gov.

Pre-registration is required.
item.name: COMMON BOSTON - Ponds, pastures and parkways: A walk along the Emerald Necklace
